title: MD
biography: Satyendra Nath Bose was an Indian theoretical physicist and mathematician. He is best known for his work on quantum mechanics in the early 1920s, in developing the foundation for Bose–Einstein statistics, and the theory of the Bose–Einstein condensate. A Fellow of the Royal Society, he was awarded India's second highest civilian award, the Padma Vibhushan, in 1954 by the Government of India.
aiSummary: S. M. Bose is a medicine specialist with an H-index of 97 at Surgical oncology (Member). Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
